meanings.definition: Give something and receive something of the same kind in return.
meanings.sent1: We were exchanging stickers at school.
meanings.sent2: The kids were happily exchanging toys with each other.
meanings.sent3: I ended up exchanging my sandwich for his apple.
meanings.sent4: The siblings were exchanging secrets like a game of catch.
meanings.sent5: The marketplace was alive with people exchanging goods and laughter.

meanings.definition: To trade or swap one thing for another.
meanings.sent1: She was exchanging her book for a new one.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors were exchanging vegetables from their gardens.
meanings.sent3: He tried exchanging his bike for a skateboard, but no luck.
meanings.sent4: The players were exchanging jerseys after the game.
meanings.sent5: The students were exchanging ideas like currency in a debate.

meanings.sent1: They were exchanging high-fives after their victory.
meanings.sent2: The couple was exchanging loving glances across the room.
meanings.sent3: I enjoy exchanging smiles with strangers on the street.
meanings.sent4: The friends were exchanging stories around the campfire.
meanings.sent5: The team was exchanging encouragement before the big match.
